title.narrative: 4.1. FORMAL BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: Equitable access to quality formal basic education, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, 850,000 children and young people (from 5 to 24 years old) have access to quality education opportunities

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF INTERIOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RECONCILIATION SOUTHWEST STATE OF SOMALIA

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

sector.narrative: Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Equitable access to quality formal basic education

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the provision of schools with essential teaching and learning materials and textbooks, with a total of 55,494 children benefiting from these supplies, which is 96% of the annual target | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of children in formal primary school receiving teaching and learning materials, including textbooks

actual.value: 2016:22,720 textbooks distributed overall NEZ: 14,720 (73% of target) CSZ: 0 NWZ: 8000 (67% of target)

title.narrative: Number of Child to Child Clubs advocating for increased enrolment

actual.value: 2016:529 CtCs were formed across the regions: NEZ: 183 (159% of target) CSZ: 225 (98% toward target) NWZ: 121 (100% of target)

title.narrative: Number of primary classrooms built or rehabilitated with funding managed by UNICEF

baseline.value: 476 TLS constructed overall. CSZ: 211 TLS (105% of TLS target) NEZ: 82 TLS (137% of TLS target) NWZ: 183 TLS (95% of TLS target)

target.value: 2017:NWZ, 100 (50 temporary classrooms; 30 permanent; 20 rehabilitated); NEZ, 65; CSZ, 288 TLS, permanent constructed and rehabilitated (200 TLS, 36 permanent classes rehabilitated and 52 new permanent constructed)

actual.value: 2018:Total: 56 Completed CSZ: 34 (Ongoing TLS; 0 permanent) NWZ: 36 (Ongoing Permanent/ new/rehab)NEZ: 56 (Completed permanent new/rehab)

title.narrative: Number of additional children enrolled in grades 1-8 (by sex)

baseline.value: NEZ, CSZ and NWZ less than 1/3 of school age population (age 6-13) enrolled

actual.value: 2016:In the current school year UNICEF contributed to an additional 12,596 children were enrolled in all zones NWZ: 973 (40.1% girls) NEZ: 2,145 (47% girls) CSZ: 9,478 (30.1% girls)

title.narrative: Number of Community Education Committees advocating for increased enrolment

actual.value: 2016:501 CeCs were trained (88% of target) NEZ: 183 (229% of target) CSZ: 225 (87% of target) NWZ: 93 (75% of target)
